result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas Carver Bell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:

*Restitution is set at $0 (zero)

*Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medication, and/or any treatment  deemed appropriate. 
*Successfully complete "Cognitive Thinking" counseling OR Criminal Thinking, whichever is deemed appropriate.
*Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 2:

Defendant sentenced to serve 180 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 22 (twenty-two) days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 year. If revoked: Huber release privileges for Day Reporting Center ONLY:

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
   
     *   Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed
          medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.          
     *   Successfully complete "Cognitive Thinking"
          counseling OR Criminal Thinking, whichever is
          deemed appropriate.
     *   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
          treatment deemed appropriate.
     *   No contact with Uhle's Tobacco Company.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges during the 
          period of probation.
          Any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due  
          immediately or an entry of a civil judgment.
      *  Restitution is set at $0 (zero).

 Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights and Pretrial Incarceration Credit; received and filed.

Defendant Thomas Carver Bell in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 2:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

AS TO COUNT 1:

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
2nd Justice Point Program violation report; received and filed. Court is DOWN until 7-23-15, will be addressed at that time.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Thomas Carver Bell in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for a plea/sentencing hearing. Defense requests additional time for defendant to arrange for elder care of his mother. GRANTED. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated May 7, 2015 received and filed.

Defendant reported to the JusticePoint office April 10, 2015. He was subjected to a breathalyzer test, and the results indicated no use of alcohol. Court would not like to take action at this time.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report for missed office contact; received and filed. Court reviewed violation, no action if defendant makes Justice Point appointment on April 10, 2015. Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Thomas Carver Bell in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing. Defense counsel needs additional time to evaluate the case. State does not object. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Program report dated March 9, 2015; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

15RM011020  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03-03-15
Court reduced cash bail to $75.00.  All other conditions of bail remain the same.

Attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub in court, defendant Thomas Carver Bell not in court, in custody not produced.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.
Defendant's appearance is waived for today's proceedings.   Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Uhle's Tobacco.

Defendant Thomas Carver Bell in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Thomas Carver Bell in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
